body:
# [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478?src=pr&el=h1) Report
> Merging [#5478](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478?src=pr&el=desc) into [master](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/commit/bea0a0aa1590d073365ecf74d75a054643dbe3b7?src=pr&el=desc) will **decrease** coverage by `<.01%`.
> The diff coverage is `75%`.

[![Impacted file tree graph](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478/graphs/tree.svg?height=150&width=650&src=pr&token=KsB0fHcx6l)](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478?src=pr&el=tree)

```diff
@@            Coverage Diff             @@
##           master    #5478      +/-   ##
==========================================
- Coverage   59.11%   59.11%   -0.01%     
==========================================
  Files         372      372              
  Lines       23751    23750       -1     
  Branches     2758     2758              
==========================================
- Hits        14041    14040       -1     
  Misses       9695     9695              
  Partials       15       15
```


| [Impacted Files](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478?src=pr&el=tree) | Coverage Δ | |
|---|---|---|
| [.../src/explore/components/ControlPanelsContainer.jsx](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-c3VwZXJzZXQvYXNzZXRzL3NyYy9leHBsb3JlL2NvbXBvbmVudHMvQ29udHJvbFBhbmVsc0NvbnRhaW5lci5qc3g=) | `88.15% <100%> (-0.16%)` | :arrow_down: |
| [superset/assets/src/explore/store.js](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478/diff?src=pr&el=tree#diff-c3VwZXJzZXQvYXNzZXRzL3NyYy9leHBsb3JlL3N0b3JlLmpz) | `23.07% <50%> (ø)` | :arrow_up: |

------

[Continue to review full report at Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478?src=pr&el=continue).
> **Legend** - [Click here to learn more](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/codecov-delta)
> `Δ = absolute <relative> (impact)`, `ø = not affected`, `? = missing data`
> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [bea0a0a...b36ae4d](https://codecov.io/gh/apache/incubator-superset/pull/5478?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).
I tried to verify this fix against Snowflake and Superset 0.26.3 (latest release) and the issue is still exist.   The workaround #4662 and #4770 only works and verified.

@mistercrunch we are getting the following error `Multiple head revisions are present for given argument 'head'; please specify a specific target revision, '<branchname>@head' to narrow to a specific head, or 'heads' for all heads`, could you please guide us why it happens everytime when we commit our code? we are fixing it by running `superset db merge heads` to resolve this problem, but we don't want to do on each commit. Please suggest the proper way to resolve it.
@mistercrunch yes, it was rebased.
@mistercrunch just checking in on this PR. Should I ping any other reviewers?

@mahendra thanks! I did it just like you said above several days ago, install selenium and webdriver, run celery worker and celery beat, after running it, I got time limit exceeded and I change the time limit in  config.py, but it doesn't work, I'd like to know some settings, such as EMAIL_REPORTS_USER, does it mean the username who is the owner of the dashboard or admin users?

@YHGui `EMAIL_REPORTS_USER` can be admin or any user who has permission to view the dashboards/slices.

```
# User credentials to use for generating reports
# This user should have permissions to browse all the dashboards and
# slices.
```

The timeout does bring an interesting point. Can you paste the stack trace here?

@vylc  Maybe you can refer to this 
https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/5429

@mahendra I deployed it on my own machine which counsumed too much cpu of my machine, now I'd like to deploy it on server which is CentOS, then rerun and get the the stack trace. But I find it hard to find the driver which is compatible with the firefox, have you deployed it on you server machine, and would you please tell me your version of firefox, geckodriver, and selenium, I get the session not created exception because of the bad compatiblity.

@mmuru That's strange, this effectively does the same thing that the workarounds do. However, this was just a hack, and will no longer work due to unrelated changes in `master` branch. However, I currently have a local build that is working very well with Snowflake (based on `master` branch), but still have to to do some additional testing. I should have a fix ready in a day or so if you want to try it out. The patch should actually work well for 0.26.3, too, if you want to backport it.
Please reopen so I can merge
Should I revert?

@mmuru did you refer to PR #5467 or this PR #4994 ? #5467 won't work for 0.26.3 as it requires changes that are present in master branch. @mistercrunch I would recommend not reverting in master, as the old workaround is not compqtible with the ned db api 1 logic. I will submit a new PR soon that should fix this problem permanently.
Ok let's push a fix through then.

@villebro: I was referring your PR #4994 change set. The #4662 workaround simply outside Superset and manually setting requires_name_normalize=False. This one was very nice but one has to manually override snowflake-sqlalchemy code. The #4770 workaround is manually edit and lower case columns within Superset. Sure, let me know when your fix is ready and I will test and verify it.
It was a connection string issue: postgresql+psycopg2 should be used

Apparently I'm blind, because I am now seeing a "No filter" option in the Time range dialog. I think the steps to reproduce are still valid, though I can work around the issue now.
@mmuru Check out #5487 . Feedback much appreciated!
@jeffreythewang shouldn't this be a new migration rather than an augmentation of the existing one?

Hmm, I'm not sure exactly what process works best for this. It's a bit tricky, as then people won't be able to cherry pick this migration fix into their internal branches (which is what I intended to do with this one). In other words, upgrades from the iso change up to but not including the new revision will have broken charts.

I assumed changing the old migration makes more sense since those who have already upgraded their database to latest may have already fixed their broken charts manually.

Have we done something similar in previous revisions?

@mahendra the log seemed like: [2018-07-26 08:01:27,956: WARNING/MainProcess] Soft time limit (150s) exceeded for email_reports.send[b6598851-f8bc-4cfa-9c47-31766aabfc58]
[2018-07-26 08:01:27,958: ERROR/MainProcess] Task handler raised error: TimeLimitExceeded(120,)
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/guiyonghui/affirm/env/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/billiard/pool.py", line 658, in on_hard_timeout
    raise TimeLimitExceeded(job._timeout)
TimeLimitExceeded: TimeLimitExceeded(120,)
[2018-07-26 08:01:27,959: ERROR/MainProcess] Hard time limit (120s) exceeded for email_reports.send[b6598851-f8bc-4cfa-9c47-31766aabfc58]
[2018-07-26 08:01:28,073: ERROR/MainProcess] Process 'ForkPoolWorker-3' pid:24793 exited with 'signal 9 (SIGKILL)'

@YHGui - the error just indicates that the task took more than 120 seconds to run. It could have been stuck in either getting the dashboard data or in sending email. 

1. Hope you set `WEBDRIVER_BASEURL` to the right public URL which is accessible from the celery process.
2. Can you try invoking the `utils.send_email_smtp` from `superset shell` and see if mails are getting delivered?

Instructions for headless firefox on centos is as follows
`yum install -y firefox`

and install `geckodriver` from https://github.com/mozilla/geckodriver/releases
anyone else has the same error?
How about using `redshift+psycopg2://` as a connection string?
I got an error from the connection string: "Can't load plugin: sqlalchemy.dialects:redshift.psycopg2"
I tried "postgres://" string and still got the same error. Not so sure whether this issue is a unique problem specific to my environment but the examples from Superset works totally fine.
Okay, so I try using other PR.

see https://github.com/attardi/deepnl/issues/54

`export` is need python2.7, but `import` is py3 better (avoid UnicodeEncodeError)
btw, i use py2 to export, and py3 to import, it works right. (not need Cython)
I installed another Superset from the scratch in another server but got the same result :(

Logic moved to #5474 .
I think, this PR #5387 will resolve this issue.
@bkyryliuk  what was the solution? Im experiencing this now, and asking users to use date.format expression on any timestamp column isnt really that viable. Perhaps ive misunderstood?

@mistercrunch any idea what to do to fix "Can't load plugin: sqlalchemy.dialects:redshift.psycopg2" error? I have these:

psycopg2==2.7.5
sqlalchemy-redshift==0.7.1
SQLAlchemy==1.2.10
Python 2.7.12

Do I need redshift-sqlalchemy instead? I am getting some installation error from "sudo pip install redshift-sqlalchemy" which I will try to fix soon hopefully and see
This was tackled fairly recently. May not be in the latest version.

The docs are pretty clear about most of what is discussed in this issue:
http://superset.apache.org/installation.html#database-dependencies
LGTM would merge. Holding a bit for confirmation from people tagged here.
Please share the stack trace, and tag the folks are would touched these area last. You can find out who touched the failing method last using `git blame`.
@mistercrunch gotcha, looking forward to solution. Let me know if I can help.

@mistercrunch how do I change one of the props in the functions of DeckGL? For example, I want to change the color prop in grid.jsx within Superset. Is that possible?

Gamma rights do not include access rights to datasources and tables. 

If you want a certain user group add a Role i.e. "VIEWER" with the access rights of the datasources you want them to access (in the dashboard).
Secondly, add the role "VIEWER" to the regarding users. 

You could add this permission: "all datasource access on all_datasource_access" or you could add individually "datasource access on [database].[table](id:xx)" for each datasource

Hey @SpyderRivera I think the problem you were experiencing was that the "Bubble Size" dropdown in the "Bubbles" section is required. When it isn't selected, `None` is passed as the secondary metric which results in the `KeyError` you see in the stack trace. The current version of Superset enforces this with a validation requiring the dropdown to be selected but if you haven't upgraded, you should be able to see the map if you select the dropdown (whether the "Show Bubbles" box is checked or not).

In theory db migrations should be immutable since some people may have checkpointed after the migration you are correcting. There may be a bit more flexibility on mutating migrations that have not yet been released to pypi, which I believe is the case here.

It's probably easier to just create a new migration.

Side note, I think we need to start tagging commits/PRs with migration as they cannot be cherry-picked and it's important to know that when doing release management.
Pandas `0.23.1` seems to work well along with py3. Maybe it's time to drop py2.7 support!?
